intro: Lepechinia lamiifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the tribe Phrymaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or pink, arranged in clusters along the stem. It thrives in rocky, dry habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities. Lepechinia lamiifolia is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access moisture.
